items.question: I have some apple trees growing in a field that used to be an orchard. Is it possible to pot these trees and grow them?
items.answer: Potting established trees is not recommended, as this would shock the roots. You could take cuttings from these trees and graft them to an appropriate root stock to establish new trees.

meta_url.path: › r/gardening  › is it possible to grow apple trees/ or any fruit tree in a pot ?

qa.question: Hi guys I just thought I’d ask this here if it’s at all possible for fruit trees to grow in a pot and if they can is there anything I’d have to do to keep it healthy like eg more nutrients or can they be grown from seed etc ?

answer.text:
It's possible, but they won't be as productive as a tree that can really spread its roots. Big trees will get big roots, and without room to expand the roots start circling the pot and becoming root bound. To counter that, you have to root prune and take off an equal amount of wood on top. That's future fruit you are cutting off.

Best bet is to buy a tree on a super dwarf root stock. Small, slow growing roots make for small, slow growing tree, and there's less removing good wood.

Apples for eating aren't grown from seed. Apples are a bit weirder than most plants in cultivation because they don't follow the usual rules that children will be like their parents. You breed two tasty tomatoes together, you'll get different but still tasty tomatoes. Two tasty apple parents usually create inedible nasty children.

Figs do very well in containers. I've grown citrus in containers. Blueberries and raspberries too (but those are not trees). Ross grows them in 20gallon pots or grow bags. results.title: Can I grow an apple tree from a seed? | Yard and Garden
results.description: It is possible to grow an apple tree from an apple seed. However, in most cases, apple trees don't come true from seeds. For example, a seed taken from a Red Delicious apple will not produce a Red Delicious apple tree. Seedling apple trees are genetically different and usually inferior to the ...
extra_snippets: It is possible to grow an apple tree from an apple seed. However, in most cases, apple trees don't come true from seeds. For example, a seed taken from a Red Delicious apple will not produce a Red Delicious apple tree. Seedling apple trees are genetically different and usually inferior to the parent tree.
